job.title: Data Scientist
job.description:
Join us in transforming the patient experience for those suffering from chronic conditions. Our goal is to create an industry leading remote monitoring solution that allows patients to be continuously monitored by their doctor while having the freedom to live their life. Alio (https://alio.ai) has offices in San Francisco and Denver Metro and also virtual teams across North America.


We have a growing team that is passionate about technology and driving to come up with the best experience possible for both the end patient and the clinicians that support them. You will work with a unique multi-sensor data stream to help drive algorithm development for vital metrics, some of which have never previously been measured non-invasively.


Responsibilities:

● Be passionate about solving critical problems. Our mission is to produce the best

possible product for patients and clinicians. We want an environment where you are

bringing your ideas to the table so that our product excels.

● Design, build and maintain machine learning models that take multi-sensor data as

input and output predictions of biological metrics and health outcomes.

● Whether working in notebooks, local scripts or deployed containers, write and test

clean, well-documented code.

● Clean, label and maintain datasets that mix time series sensor data and health

information to enable efficient model development.

● Perform tests, apply rigorous statistical analysis and present results to a variety of

audiences comprising everyone from laypeople to domain experts.

● Define product requirements as part of a cross-functional team and write excellent

documentation as part of our quality system.


Successful candidates will possess the following experience, skills, and interests:

● Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics or related field.

● 4+ years of experience with Python required.

● 2+ years of experience with machine learning frameworks, such as PyTorch,

TensorFlow or Keras.

● Experience with time-series data strongly preferred.

● Extensive experience with and knowledge of mathematics, statistics, data structures

and algorithms.

● A great communicator who knows how to work in an agile environment.


Preferred qualifications:

● Post-graduate degree in a relevant discipline.

● Experience with neural networks or other deep learning architectures.

● Experience working with healthcare data.

● Experience working with IoT devices and associated data.

● Experience deploying software utilizing the AWS Well Architected Framework.
